nodes.name: Jason Clinton
nodes.description: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) - Jason Clinton serves as Anthropic's Chief Information Security Officer, responsible for overseeing the company's information security strategy and ensuring the protection of its digital assets. He has extensive experience in software engineering and cybersecurity.
research: Leading discussions on AI virtual employee security challenges
Developing cybersecurity strategies for AI agent management
Implementing safety measures for AI systems with corporate credentials
Advocating for visibility tools and account classification systems for virtual employees

nodes.name: Jan Leike
nodes.description: Head of Superalignment/AI Safety - Jan Leike leads Anthropic's superalignment team focusing on AI safety and security. He joined from OpenAI where he was a lead safety researcher. His team works on scalable oversight, weak-to-strong generalization, and automated alignment research.
research: Leading superalignment research at Anthropic
Developing scalable oversight techniques for AI systems
Advancing weak-to-strong generalization methods
Automated alignment research for superintelligent AI control

nodes.name: Chris Olah
nodes.description: Co-Founder and Head of Interpretability Team - Chris Olah is a co-founder of Anthropic who leads the lab's interpretability team. He focuses on understanding how AI systems work internally and developing methods to make them more transparent and interpretable.
research: Leading AI interpretability research
Developing techniques to understand neural network behavior
Advancing transparency in AI systems
Research on feature identification in AI models

nodes.name: Richard Fontaine
nodes.description: Long-Term Benefit Trust Member (National Security Expert) - Richard Fontaine was appointed to Anthropic's Long-Term Benefit Trust in 2025, bringing extensive national security experience to help guide the company through complex AI security challenges. The Trust has governance authority over Anthropic's board.
research: Providing national security guidance for AI development
Advising on AI applications for defense and security sectors
Helping navigate complex security considerations for advanced AI

nodes.name: Jason Matheny
nodes.description: Long-Term Benefit Trust Member - Jason Matheny serves as CEO of the RAND Corporation and is one of the initial trustees of Anthropic's Long-Term Benefit Trust. He brings expertise in AI safety, national security, and policy to the governance of Anthropic.
research: Governance oversight through Long-Term Benefit Trust
AI safety and security policy guidance
National security considerations for AI development

nodes.name: Dan Hendrycks
